body:
Dear Thomas,






Su2rad seems to miss “convert.exe”, which doesn’t appear in the SketchUp folder even after the reinstallation of the plugin. Below you can find the report from the Ruby console.


It would be great if you knew how to fix the problem. Thank you for your help!






RunTimeConfig.initialize()


RunTimeConfig: initPaths() ...


  searching 'replmarks.exe' ...


  => found 'replmarks.exe' in 'C:/Users/ilkkrola/AppData/Roaming/SketchUp/SketchUp 2016/SketchUp/Plugins/su2radlib/bin/WIN'


  searching 'convert.exe' ...


  ... skipping system folder 'C:\Windows\system32'


  ... skipping system folder 'C:\Windows\System32\Wbem'


  ... skipping system folder 'C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\'


  => application 'convert.exe' not found


  searching 'ra_ppm.exe' ...


  => found 'ra_ppm.exe' in 'C:/Users/ilkkrola/AppData/Roaming/SketchUp/SketchUp 2016/SketchUp/Plugins/su2radlib/bin/WIN'


  searching 'obj2mesh.exe' ...


  => found 'obj2mesh.exe' in 'C:/Users/ilkkrola/AppData/Roaming/SketchUp/SketchUp 2016/SketchUp/Plugins/su2radlib/bin/WIN'


WARNING: path for CONVERT does not exist ('')










###  su2rad.rb export  ###


searching in 'C:/Users/ilkkrola/AppData/Roaming/SketchUp/SketchUp 2016/SketchUp/Plugins/su2radlib/ray'


> 130 materials in file 'C:/Users/ilkkrola/AppData/Roaming/SketchUp/SketchUp 2016/SketchUp/Plugins/su2radlib/ray/K_and_E.rad'


>  69 materials in file 'C:/Users/ilkkrola/AppData/Roaming/SketchUp/SketchUp 2016/SketchUp/Plugins/su2radlib/ray/materials.rad'


>  33 materials in file 'C:/Users/ilkkrola/AppData/Roaming/SketchUp/SketchUp 2016/SketchUp/Plugins/su2radlib/ray/ral.rad'


=> materials total: 232


        plastic: 212


          metal: 4


          glass: 12


        texfunc: 2


     brightfunc: 1


          alias: 1






[W] 'convert' not found => disabling 'textures' options


###  finished: 2016-04-20 17:27:48 +0200  ###


###  status: running (groups=0, faces=7)  ###


















Von: Thomas Bleicher [mailto:tbleicher at gmail.com] 
Gesendet: Mittwoch, 20. April 2016 03:58
An: Radiance general discussion
Betreff: Re: [Radiance-general] su2rad export problem






Hi






I just tried it with SketchUp Make 2016 on a Windows 10 system. I'm pretty sure there isn't a general problem with Windows 7 or I'd have heard about it by now.






Can you try to export again with the Ruby console window open, please? There should be some information when the script starts and especially when there is an error. Please copy the output and send it over.






Regards,


Thomas
___
